thread.title: S’porean allegedly murders wife and sets her body on fire
thread.title_full: S’porean allegedly murders wife and sets her body on fire

title: S’porean allegedly murders wife and sets her body on fire
text:
S’porean allegedly murders wife and sets her body on fire No escape: Teo, being escorted by police. 
A SINGAPOREAN man allegedly murdered his pregnant wife and set her body on fire about a week later on the first day of Chinese New Year, Nanyang Siang Pau reported. 
Teo Ghim Heng, 41, was charged in court on Monday with the murder of his wife. 
The body of the victim, Choong Pei Shan, 39, was found with her four-year-old daughter in the bedroom. 
Choong was six months’ pregnant when she was murdered on Jan 20, between 8am to 11am. The victim Choong Pei Shan,39 and her four year old daughter. 
Her elder brother made the discovery when he visited the couple’s flat at Woodlands with the police on Saturday. 
He tried to call his sister, who promised to have the reunion dinner with their family on the eve of Chinese New Year. 
The matter involving the four-year-old daughter is still under investigation. 
> Police arrested 49 people for illegal gambling in forest areas of Selangor and Negri Sembilan on Sunday, China Press reported. 
RM141,033 in cash and RM125,000 in cheques were confiscated by the Bukit Aman Special Task Force for Anti-Vice, Gambling and Gang­sterism (STAGG). 
In an operation called Ops Orange , the STAGG team spent 12 hours cracking down on these illegal gambling dens set up at five different locations and guarded by security guards. 
● Found in Translation is compiled from the vernacular newspapers (Bahasa Malaysia, Chinese and Tamil dailies). As such, stories are grouped according to the respective language/medium. Where a paragraph begins with this ' >'sign, it denotes a separate news item.
